alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds bearing the group N3, viz. -N=N+=N-.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic azides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nitrides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds containing a mercury atom.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic mercury compounds

class.description: Inorganic compounds belonging to either the alkaline earth metal hydrides, alkaline earth metal nitrides, alkaline earth metal oxides, alkaline earth metal sulfides.
class.name: Transition metal organides

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as transition metal nitrides. These are inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest metal atom is a transition metal.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest metal atom is a transition metal.
direct_parent.name: Transition metal nitrides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest metal atom is a transition metal.
subclass.name: Transition metal nitrides

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
